definition: Adapted to its use or purpose, or to wants and necessities; serviceable; spacious and convenient; roomy and comfortable; as, a commodious house. "A commodious drab." Shak. "Commodious gold." Pope. The haven was not commodious to winter in. Acts. xxvii. 12. Syn. -- Convenient; suitable; fit; proper; advantageous; serviceable; useful; spacious; comfortable.
